did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: 3 seven drawer filing cabinets, and 16.3 cubic feet
Correspondence, clippings, articles, photographs, reports, brochures, syllabi, notes, teaching materials, diary notes, reviews, speeches, bulletins, memoranda.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
did.abstract: Personal and professional papers and biographical information about Professor Stycos, sociologist, photographer and professor of sociology.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Joseph Mayone Stycos received a B.A. from Princeton University and a Ph.D. from Columbia University. After serving as one of the first Population Council Fellows (1954-55), he came to Cornell in 1957. In 1962, he founded the International Population Program, which he directed until 1992. He also served as Professor of Sociology, and chair of the Department of Sociology and Anthropology (1966-1970), as director of the Latin American Studies Program (1962-1966) and as Professor of Rural Sociology (1988- ). He has authored numerous books and articles on population issues including birth control, fertility, socio-psychological dimensions in husband-wife relations, adolescence, survey research, and population and the environment. Most of his work focused on Latin America, but he also gave attention to Egypt, India, China, Poland, Turkey, and the U.S. Throughout his career, he was an avid photographer, and illustrated a number of his books with photographs taken during the course of his research, including a book of photographs, entitled Children of the Barriada and one entitled Margin of Life, on which he collaborated with Cornell Capa.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Stycos photograph collection includes photos from around the world on a wide range of subjects, plants, people buildings. Includes photographs of China, focusing on images relating to population control programs, taken in 1989. Many photos of Central America, India, Europe, and Upstate New York. Includes photographs of China, focusing on images relating to population control programs, taken in 1989. Also, biographical information about Professor Stycos, correspondence, articles, annual reports, department files, and course material.

Index at front. 11 x 14, black and white, largely from the 1970s. Locations include: Lansing N.Y., Brighton England, Twin Glens woods Ithaca, Peru, Port of Spain Trinidad, Digby Nova Scotia, Brazil, Mexico City, Senegal, others.

Index at front. 11 x 14, black and white. Locations include: Twin Glens Ithaca, pipes, JFK airport, Treman Park, Buenos Aires, New Paltz, Saugerties, Geneva N.Y., Bogota Columbia, Tegucigalpa, Digby Nova Scotia, others.

Index at front. 11 x 14, black and white. Locations include: Copper canyon, Eiffel Tower Paris France, Lehigh Valley train, Central New York, England, Dunedin Florida, Digby Nova Scotia, Freeville N.Y., Aruba, Cornell Plantations, Mexico, Buenos Aires, others.

Index at front. 11 x 14, color. Locations include: Peru, Havana Cuba, River Po, Guatemala, Twin Glens Ithaca, Sapsucker Woods, Danube River Austria, Merida Mexico, Florida, Cornell, Tappan Zee Bridge New York, Aurora, and others.
Index at front. 11 x 14, color. Locations include: Washington D.C., Spain, Malta, Oxaca Mexico, Merida, Mexico City, Twin Glens Ithaca, Cayuga Lake, Cuba, Danube River Austria, others.

Index at front. 11 x 14, mainly black and white, some color. Locations include: Warsaw Poland, Venice Italy, Tompkins County, Costa Rica, Maryland, Buenos Aires Argentina, Geneva Switzerland,Twin Glens Ithaca, Ottawa Canada, Florida, Cornell Plantations, Libe Slope Cornell, Lansing New York,, Digby Canada, Peru, England, others.

Index at front. 11 x 14, color. Locations include: Twin Glens Ithaca, Merida Mexico, Malta, Provence France, Copper canyon, Lake Titicaca, Rome Italy, Havana Cuba, Sapsucker Woods, Poland, London England, others.

Index at front. 13 x 19, color. Locations include: Sapsucker Woods, Copper Canyon, Cornell Plantations, Danube Austria, Upstate New York, Merida, New Tate Museum, Tompkins County, Lucerne Switzerland, Clifford, New York, Gore Island Senegal. Also a photo of Maria Stycos and one of Sid Vicious graffiti

Index at front. 11 x 17, black and white and color. Locations include: New York State, Zocalo, Mexico City, Nature, Copper Canyon, Tompkins County, Cuba, Hotel Tequendama Columbia, Jamaica Inn Florida, Saugerties New York, and others.
Index at front. 11 x 14, black and white and color. Locations include: Honduras, Aurora, Syracuse, Freeville, Ithaca, New York, Mexico City, Digby Canada, Warsaw, El Salvador others.
Index at front. 11 x 14, various. Album appears to have been disassembled as it is mostly empty.

Articles, correspondence, and publications about Greece and Greeks. Includes paper titled Cyprus and the Greco-Turkish Conflict by Steven Stycos, Greek Immigration, Greeks of Ithaca,
Includes stationary for Stycos Cleaners, various letters, and notes.
